commentDetails.text: # this maps the DRUM sourcesystem to the trade systems SYSTEM_MAP
#RAM, S1 and EQY in Drum are all equivalent to RAM in sample
### This method is a non-dag convenience method for the now multiple times we want
### to derive out IDs from the System full name
### We have to defend against the index size
# used only to be consistent with EventName in SimpleEventHelper. Bleh.
#XXX Use ErrorStack to access this field reliably.
# Older versions of sampleError stored stack traces as a list of strings (despite saying returns=str).
# Current version stores a string instead.
# sampleMTMTransaction's does not have sampleEventLogRecord so we don't want to add it here
# this isn't great, but its manageable
#convenience for when we only want external types
# make ACK win in case we get both a WACK and an ACK
# completionStatuses: values that update audit history
# publishedStatuses: values that COULD update audit history
# DEPRECATED the sampleEventProcessType will be OOS, and this value would be UNKNOWN
### JEB here - there's an edge case where the fee is active but in the past where we potentially misreport.
### currently only ORCA sends isActive and stated this won't occur so we're going to assume that a isActive=False
### is enough to suppress the fee.
### Frankly I'm more worried about the edge case where another system is sending us dates willy-nilly and no isActive flag
### which would cause us to suppress perfectly legitimate fees. (hence this implementation which will not allow for it)
# so after looking at all the logic, it turns out we only report when the
# fee is in the future. We don't actually care about the isActive flag it turns out.
# DEPRECATED the greenline team is evil.

'''
Id: "$Id: basetypes.py,v 1.228 2017/06/21 08:18:27 hpatel17 Exp $"
Description:
Test: [ops.sample.tests.unittests.basetypes, ops.tests.functionaltests.sample.audit]
'''

errorDetails.errorMsg: extraneous input ' ' expecting {'def', 'return', 'raise', 'from', 'import', 'global', 'nonlocal', 'assert', 'if', 'while', 'for', 'try', 'with', 'lambda', 'not', 'None', 'True', 'False', 'class', 'yield', 'del', 'pass', 'continue', 'break', NAME, STRING_LITERAL, BYTES_LITERAL, DECIMAL_INTEGER, OCT_INTEGER, HEX_INTEGER, BIN_INTEGER, FLOAT_NUMBER, IMAG_NUMBER, '...', '*', '(', '[', '+', '-', '~', '{', '@', DEDENT}
errorDetails.name: basetypes

errorDetails.errorMsg: extraneous input '\n' expecting {<EOF>, 'def', 'return', 'raise', 'from', 'import', 'global', 'nonlocal', 'assert', 'if', 'while', 'for', 'try', 'with', 'lambda', 'not', 'None', 'True', 'False', 'class', 'yield', 'del', 'pass', 'continue', 'break', NEWLINE, NAME, STRING_LITERAL, BYTES_LITERAL, DECIMAL_INTEGER, OCT_INTEGER, HEX_INTEGER, BIN_INTEGER, FLOAT_NUMBER, IMAG_NUMBER, '...', '*', '(', '[', '+', '-', '~', '{', '@'}
errorDetails.name: basetypes

RedshiftCatalogerQueries.getRedshiftSchemas: select s.nspname as table_schema, s.oid as schema_id, u.usename as owner from pg_catalog.pg_namespace s join pg_catalog.pg_user u on u.usesysid = s.nspowner Where nspname not like 'pg_toast%' and nspname not like 'pg_temp_%' and nspname not like 'spectrum%' order by table_schema;

CAEORACLE.getTableCount:
select (select count(*) as table_name from all_objects t where object_type = 'TABLE' and owner = 'ORACLE12C_SCHEMA1')+
(select count(*) as table_name from all_objects t where object_type = 'TABLE' and owner = 'ORACLE12C_SCHEMA2')+(SELECT count(*) FROM DBA_OBJECTS
WHERE OBJECT_TYPE = 'VIEW' AND  owner = 'ORACLE12C_SCHEMA2')+(SELECT count(*) FROM DBA_OBJECTS  WHERE OBJECT_TYPE = 'VIEW' AND  owner = 'ORACLE12C_SCHEMA1') 
+(SELECT count(*) FROM DBA_OBJECTS
WHERE OBJECT_TYPE = 'TABLE' AND  owner = 'ORACLE12C_LINEAGESCHEMA1' and GENERATED='N')+(SELECT count(*) FROM DBA_OBJECTS  WHERE OBJECT_TYPE = 'VIEW' AND  owner = 'ORACLE12C_LINEAGESCHEMA1') 
AS Count from dual
CAEORACLE.getColumnCount: Select(select count(*) from all_tab_columns where owner = 'ORACLE12C_SCHEMA1')+(select count(*) from all_tab_columns where owner = 'ORACLE12C_SCHEMA2')+(select count(*) from all_tab_columns where owner = 'ORACLE12C_LINEAGESCHEMA1') AS count FROM dual
CAEORACLE.getIndexCount: Select (SELECT count(*) INDEX_NAME FROM ALL_INDEXES WHERE  OWNER = 'ORACLE12C_SCHEMA1')+(SELECT count(*) INDEX_NAME FROM ALL_INDEXES WHERE  OWNER = 'ORACLE12C_SCHEMA2')+(SELECT count(*) INDEX_NAME FROM ALL_INDEXES WHERE  OWNER = 'ORACLE12C_LINEAGESCHEMA1')AS count from dual
CAEORACLE.getConstraintCount: Select (SELECT count(*) FROM all_constraints WHERE owner = 'ORACLE12C_SCHEMA1' AND CONSTRAINT_TYPE IN ('C','R'))+(SELECT count(*) FROM all_constraints WHERE owner = 'ORACLE12C_SCHEMA2' AND CONSTRAINT_TYPE IN ('R','C'))+(SELECT count(*) FROM all_constraints WHERE owner = 'ORACLE12C_LINEAGESCHEMA1' AND CONSTRAINT_TYPE IN ('C','R')) AS count from dual
CAEORACLE.getTriggerCount:
SELECT(SELECT count(*) FROM ALL_PROCEDURES  WHERE OBJECT_TYPE='TRIGGER' AND OWNER='ORACLE12C_SCHEMA1')+(SELECT count(*) FROM ALL_PROCEDURES  WHERE OBJECT_TYPE='TRIGGER' AND OWNER='ORACLE12C_SCHEMA2')+
+(SELECT count(*) FROM ALL_PROCEDURES  WHERE OBJECT_TYPE='TRIGGER' AND OWNER='ORACLE12C_LINEAGESCHEMA1') AS count from dual
CAEORACLE.getRoutineCount:
Select(SELECT count(*) FROM ALL_PROCEDURES WHERE  OWNER='ORACLE12C_SCHEMA1' AND (OBJECT_TYPE='PROCEDURE' OR OBJECT_TYPE='FUNCTION'))+
(SELECT count(*) FROM ALL_PROCEDURES WHERE OWNER='ORACLE12C_SCHEMA2'AND (OBJECT_TYPE='PROCEDURE' OR OBJECT_TYPE='FUNCTION'))+
(SELECT count(*) FROM ALL_PROCEDURES WHERE OWNER='ORACLE12C_LINEAGESCHEMA1'AND (OBJECT_TYPE='PROCEDURE' OR OBJECT_TYPE='FUNCTION')) AS count from dual
